H0.text: The number of valence electrons is closely related to the tendency of an element to react chemically.

H1.text: The ratio of protons to neutrons is closely related to an element's tendency to react chemically.

H2.text: How tightly atoms are packed is closely related to the tendency of an element to react chemically.

H3.text: The number of neutrons in atoms is closely related to the tendency of an element to react chemically.

A4.text: The number of valence electrons in an atom governs its bonding behavior.

A5.text: An atom with one or two valence electrons more than a closed shell is highly reactive due to the relatively low energy to remove the extra valence electrons to form a positive ion.
